title: Safe Word: Van Cleef & Arpels Transforms Rockefeller Center With an Immersive Floral Takeover
excerpt: Read our roundup of the best jewelry news, launches, and happenings this month to stay up to date on all things sparkly.
text: Van Cleef & Arpels Transforms New York City Into a Lush GardenCourtesy of Van Cleef & ArpelsSpring is in full bloom at Rockefeller Center’s Channel Gardens and Summer Rink, thanks to Van Cleef & Arpels. The renowned fine and high jewelry brand—celebrated for its nature-inspired, floral motifs—has teamed up with French artist Alexandre Benjamin Navet to transform the heart of the city into an interactive spring garden. Throughout the first three weekends of May, visitors can enjoy poetry readings, dance performances, and live painting sessions, all set amid Navet’s vibrant artistic installations.David Yurman Opens New Flagship in Miami’s Design DistrictCourtesy of David YurmanRenowned jewelry brand David Yurman has touched down in Miami’s Design District with a brand-new flagship store, designed in partnership with architect Andrea Tognon of Studio Tognon. The space is heavily inspired by the designer’s pieces, with arches created to mimic the natural curve of a his necklaces and stone finishes reminiscent of the precious stones used throughout his work. The iconic Cable design is present, too, with a sculpted handrail at the store entrance and circular vitrine underneath the staircase. Exclusive styles inspired by Miami’s vibrant spirit will be available to shop, with stones in bright pink, green, blue, and orange.
html:
Van Cleef & Arpels Transforms New York City Into a Lush Garden

Spring is in full bloom at Rockefeller Center’s Channel Gardens and Summer Rink, thanks to Van Cleef & Arpels. The renowned fine and high jewelry brand—celebrated for its nature-inspired, floral motifs—has teamed up with French artist Alexandre Benjamin Navet to transform the heart of the city into an interactive spring garden. Throughout the first three weekends of May, visitors can enjoy poetry readings, dance performances, and live painting sessions, all set amid Navet’s vibrant artistic installations.

David Yurman Opens New Flagship in Miami’s Design District

Renowned jewelry brand David Yurman has touched down in Miami’s Design District with a brand-new flagship store, designed in partnership with architect Andrea Tognon of Studio Tognon. The space is heavily inspired by the designer’s pieces, with arches created to mimic the natural curve of a his necklaces and stone finishes reminiscent of the precious stones used throughout his work. The iconic Cable design is present, too, with a sculpted handrail at the store entrance and circular vitrine underneath the staircase. Exclusive styles inspired by Miami’s vibrant spirit will be available to shop, with stones in bright pink, green, blue, and orange.
